title: The C.I.A. Helped Pinpoint a Gathering of Iranian Leaders. Then Israel Struck.
summary: The killing of Iran’s supreme leader and other top Iranian officials came after close intelligence sharing between the United States and Israel, according to people familiar with the operation.

title: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Hard-Line Cleric Who Made Iran a Regional Power, Is Dead at 86
summary: As Iran’s second supreme leader, he brutally crushed dissent at home and expanded Iran’s footprint abroad, challenging Saudi Arabia for regional dominance.

title: See a Breakdown of Ayatollah Khamenei and Other Top Iranian Leaders
summary: Among those killed in strikes, according to the U.S. and Israel, were Iran’s supreme leader and three of his top military commanders.

title: Elite Doctors Served Jeffrey Epstein While Treating His ‘Girls’
summary: A small stable of doctors gave V.I.P. medical services to the sex offender and the women around him. Some doctors bent or broke the ethical rules of their profession.

title: QAnon Faithful See Validation in the Epstein Files
summary: The nearly decade-old conspiracy theory does not align neatly with the facts emerging from the documents. That does not seem to matter.

title: Epstein Effort to Finance a Dick Cavett Film Undone by Background Check
summary: Jeffrey Epstein joined Mr. Cavett’s wife in an effort to create a PBS documentary on the talk-show legend. But then the producers did a background check on the financier.

title: Kash Patel’s Girlfriend Seeks Fame and Fortune, Escorted by an F.B.I. SWAT Team
summary: Former F.B.I. officials say Mr. Patel beefed up field office staffing near his girlfriend in Nashville and ordered a team to ferry her on errands and to events.

title: A Tale of Two Seasons at Columbia, and Two Responses to Student Arrests
summary: When Mahmoud Khalil was detained by immigration agents last year, the university’s response was restrained. It was different with Elmina Aghayeva this week.

title: In Ukraine, a Community of ‘Simple Believers’ Shuns the Modern World
summary: The Christians known as viruiuchi prostaky see electricity, cars, higher education and much else as distractions from what really matters.

title: How Wesley Hunt of Texas Is Working in Plain Sight With Outside Groups
summary: Exchanges between two X accounts appear to offer a vivid example of how campaigns may sidestep campaign-finance law to share strategic information.

title: Trump Decision to Strike Iran Opens Fissures in Midterms
summary: Republicans largely supported the decision, while Democrats mostly opposed it — but divisions appeared in both parties.

title: Could the Supreme Court’s Voting Rights Act Decision Affect the Midterms?
summary: The court is set to decide a major case that could scramble the country’s congressional maps. One crucial factor for this year’s elections is when the ruling lands.

title: Regime Change in Iran? 4 Opinion Writers on Khamenei Strike.
summary: How should Americans feel about the potential for regime change? What happens now?

title: Iran Got Trump All Wrong
summary: We should not squander this moment, when Iran is uniquely weak and vulnerable and we hold all of the advantages — literally.

title: Death of Girl From Los Angeles School Investigated as a Homicide, Police Say
summary: The Los Angeles police did not offer details on the death of a student at Reseda High School, but a family said that a 12-year-old girl attending the school died after being struck with a water bottle.

title: How the BAFTAs Bungled Its Response to a Racial Slur
summary: The awards show didn’t mention racist slurs when it told the audience that a man with Tourette’s might make “involuntarily noises.”

title: New Geothermal Technology Aims to Produce Clean Energy in Germany
summary: Developers are using a new geothermal technology in Germany to produce clean energy.
